			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[post_sidebar]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{s:15:"sidebar-primary";s:0:"";s:11:"footer-area";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_post_restored_from]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:3:{s:20:"restored_revision_id";i:16;s:16:"restored_by_user";i:1;s:13:"restored_time";i:1459339045;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_tm_pb_use_builder]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[off]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_tm_pb_old_content]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<h4>Bad breath is a deal breaker both in business and in personal life of ours. And while breath fresheners or candies hide it, they do not cure the very problem at hand...</h4><p>So, most importantly, the bad breath is caused by a lack of oral hygiene. It includes sleeping with an open mouth at night. This makes mouth dry and bacterias began to flourish there and cause that smell...</p><p>Bad breath has a medical name "halitosis". This kind of condition can stem from poor oral hygiene habits. It also may be a telling sign of other health problems. What you're eating can cause this disease to progress much faster. So how healthy your menu is directly correlated with any oral hygiene problems.</p><h6>So, how your diet and dishes choice affects the smell of your breath?</h6><p>Essentially, everything you're consuming begins to be broken down into parts in your mouth. As dishes are digested and absorbed into the blood system, foods eventually get carried to your lungs. Then it reveals in your breath. This is even more true in case you like foods with strong odors (such as garlic or onions). Then teeth brushing and flossing, even mouthwash and any other breath freshening liquids are redundant. They merely disguise that kind of odor temporarily. The odor will not go away completely until the foods have passed through your body completely...</p><blockquote><h4><q>How damaging abundant amount of sugar is for your teeth health?</q></h4><h6><cite>—John Doe</cite></h6></blockquote><h6>Which poor oral hygiene habits lead to the bad breath?</h6><p>First off, ask yourself do you regularly follow basic oral hygiene routines? This, of course, includes such morning musts as brushing your teeth twice a day. Keep in mind, that each brushing should be lasting for at least 5 minutes. It's not limited to that. Teeth flossing after each eating is also strongly recommended. Because when you eat and don't follow these methods, food particles stay in your mouth. They get stuck in between the teeth, on gums and the tongue. Then it decays and absorbs there, causing various oral bacteria to flourish. All this results in a bad breath. Antibacterial mouth rinsers, instead of simple breath fresheners, may be of a big help here.</p><p><em>It will not simply disguise the smell by replacing it with a nicer aroma. These antibacterial mouth rinsers will eventually fight off and kick out the bacteria from your mouth. As well as off the teeth, gums and tongue.</em></p><p>To add to that you must keep an especially attentive eye on your dentures, if you have any. They are critically vulnerable towards the odor-causing bacteria. If the dentures are not cleaned properly, and even more importantly, regularly, it will get covered with invisible bacteria. This will be causing bad smells, that will be obvious to absolutely everyone around. There's also no better way to hazard you oral hygiene and health than smoking or chewing tobacco. Besides irritating the sensitive gums and making teeth yellow, this makes the bacterias prosper. It adds up to a smell too...</p><h6> Are there any specific health issues that are connected to a bad breath?</h6><p>Such a thing as the periodontal disease may be an essential cause of the bad breath. So if smell and unpleasant taste in your mouth are a lasting issue, you'd better check with your dentist. Specifically on the matter of whether you have periodontal disease or not. Gum disease is caused by the appearance of plaque on teeth. Bacteria cause the formation of toxins to form, which irritate the gums and enamel. If such a gum disease carries on without any treatment to it provided, it can damage the gums and jawbone. Other dental causes of bad breath include poorly fitting dental appliances, yeast infections of the mouth, and denta</p><p>The medical condition of the dry mouth (also called xerostomia) also can cause a bad smell. Saliva is necessary to moisten the mouth. It neutralizes acids produced by plaque and piles away the dead cells off the tongue, gums, and cheeks' insides. If not removed, these cells begin to decay and can cause bad breath. Dry mouth may be a side effect of various medications. Also salivary gland problems or breathing with your mouth open can be an additional cause. Many other general diseases and illnesses may cause bad breath. Here are some to be aware of: respiratory tract infections such as pneumonia or bronchitis, chronic sinus infections, postnasal drip, diabetes, chronic acid reflux, and liver or kidney problems.</p>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Avoid skin care products with these ingredients</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/07/14/avoid-skin-care-products-with-these-ingredients/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Jul 2016 10:01:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=29</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

While I was on track to find out more about the secret to a clear skin I've learned a few things. Firstly, it is definitely worth avoiding some of the heavily chemical ingredients, which are usually included typical makeups contents.

But then again, a majority of the natural skin care products tend to contain coconut oil, which is rather comedogenic. And this basically leaves me wondering now...

But anyway… let’s talk about which specific chemicals and comedogenic ingredients are the ones to be definitely avoided in your makeup products, and why.

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in

&nbsp;
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.

&nbsp;
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Extreme skin sensitivity</span></h4>
Clogged Pores, Sensitive Red Skin, Rosacea are all the telling signs that your skin health suffers from an extreme sensitivity...

The chemicals included in it, can act to heighten an increase in skin's sensitivity, as well as it can thin your skin and remove the protective barrier. This means that the skin and pores become too responsive towards what you're applying on it.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.

&nbsp;
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Trapped skin pores inflammation</span></h4>
The blood flow, which usually follows even the slightest skin stimulation then gets trapped within the pore. Those pores, in turn, get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and chemical ingredients, which will simply stagnate there.

This blood flow stagnation scars the natural collagen in the pore (collagen being our skin’s supportive and regenerative component), so the scar tissue will die and get clogged inside the pore alongside the dead skin cells.

This results in scarring, pitting, big pores, and lots of redness and breakouts. If you can't yet spot that scarring on the surface now, if left unfixed it will inevitably become more visible over time.

And if the pressure in the skin's pores gets too high, it will become full on inflammation, rupture the pore and spread to the next pore, spreading the problem across your skin.
<h6><strong>Okay so let’s get to the ingredients oftentimes used in the skin care products, that you may want to be avoiding:</strong></h6>
&nbsp;
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Silicones</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Methicone, dimethicone, trimethicone, cyclomethicone, siloxane, cyclopentasiloxane, cyclotetrasiloxane, cyclohexasiloxane, silsesquioxane, trimethylsiloxysilicate, methylpolysiloxane, stearoxytrimethylsilane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Add a silky and smooth touch...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Apparently silicones are one of the most harmful ingredients out there. They contribute to dehydrating the skin and clogging the pores, which oftentimes marks the beginning of redness, pore scarring, and acne breakouts.

&nbsp;
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Petrochemicals</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Paraffin wax, mineral oil, toluene, benzene, petrolatum, and anything that ends in “eth”, “decane”, or contains the words PEG (polyethylene glycol), DEA (diethanolamine), MEA (ethanolamine), TEA (triethanolamine), butyl, methyl, propyl, ethyl, ethanol

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

It usually either locks the moisture in the skin pores, keeping it moisturized or acts as a skin preservative in any other relevant way...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Petroleum derived ingredients are pore clogging components, which work as a delivery agent, meaning they trap all other junk in the product deeper into the pores. Sometimes they may come with such hazardous ingredients as the 1,4-dioxane, a carcinogen and neurotoxin...

&nbsp;
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Parabens</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

acnemethylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparaben, butylparaben

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

All of these are highly toxic and are harmful to your endocrine system. In other words, those are hormone messer uppers. When you are trying to heal from acne, you don’t want that.

&nbsp;
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Phthalates</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Usually, those ingredients are meant to homogenize the product and dissolve solid ingredients. Also used to make the fragrance stay...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Same as parabens… they disrupt your hormones and mess the hormone system up...

&nbsp;

To summarize, it's important to keep in mind that when you look up for your skin care product's contents, the ingredients are enlisted with the highest quantity first. They go down the list in a descending order (from more to less)...

So the first ingredient listed is the main ingredient with the highest quantity of the product.

If you come across a “baddie” ingredient it’s going to be less of a big deal if it’s at the end of the list (ex. 0.05% of the whole product), rather than if it’s close to the top (ex. 50% of the whole product).

</div>
[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section]]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[getting-that-pre-baby-body-back]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Aesthetician&#039;s advice: cleaning pores</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/05/15/aestheticians-advice-cleaning-pores/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 May 2016 11:58:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=32</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For <a href="http://www.templatemonster.com/">people</a> who suffer from having blackheads on their skin, sometimes it may seem that we'd all be better off without pores. Because, blackheads are basically just the skin pores that have been clogged with dirt, dead cells, and bacteria... Unfortunately to all of us, we actually need those pores.

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Extreme skin sensitivity</span></h4>
Clogged Pores, Sensitive Red Skin, Rosacea are all the telling signs that your skin health suffers from an extreme sensitivity...

The chemicals included in it, can act to heighten an increase in skin's sensitivity, as well as it can thin your skin and remove the protective barrier. This means that the skin and pores become too responsive towards what you're applying on it.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Trapped skin pores inflammation</span></h4>
The blood flow, which usually follows even the slightest skin stimulation then gets trapped within the pore. Those pores, in turn, get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and chemical ingredients, which will simply stagnate there.

This blood flow stagnation scars the natural collagen in the pore (collagen being our skin’s supportive and regenerative component), so the scar tissue will die and get clogged inside the pore alongside the dead skin cells.

This results in scarring, pitting, big pores, and lots of redness and breakouts. If you can't yet spot that scarring on the surface now, if left unfixed it will inevitably become more visible over time.

And if the pressure in the skin's pores gets too high, it will become full on inflammation, rupture the pore and spread to the next pore, spreading the problem across your skin.
<h6><strong>Okay so let’s get to the ingredients oftentimes used in the skin care products, that you may want to be avoiding:</strong></h6>
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Silicones</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Methicone, dimethicone, trimethicone, cyclomethicone, siloxane, cyclopentasiloxane, cyclotetrasiloxane, cyclohexasiloxane, silsesquioxane, trimethylsiloxysilicate, methylpolysiloxane, stearoxytrimethylsilane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Add a silky and smooth touch...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Apparently silicones are one of the most harmful ingredients out there. They contribute to dehydrating the skin and clogging the pores, which oftentimes marks the beginning of redness, pore scarring, and acne breakouts.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Petrochemicals</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Paraffin wax, mineral oil, toluene, benzene, petrolatum, and anything that ends in “eth”, “decane”, or contains the words PEG (polyethylene glycol), DEA (diethanolamine), MEA (ethanolamine), TEA (triethanolamine), butyl, methyl, propyl, ethyl, ethanol

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

It usually either locks the moisture in the skin pores, keeping it moisturized or acts as a skin preservative in any other relevant way...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Petroleum derived ingredients are pore clogging components, which work as a delivery agent, meaning they trap all other junk in the product deeper into the pores. Sometimes they may come with such hazardous ingredients as the 1,4-dioxane, a carcinogen and neurotoxin...
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Parabens</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

acnemethylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparaben, butylparaben

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

All of these are highly toxic and are harmful to your endocrine system. In other words, those are hormone messer uppers. When you are trying to heal from acne, you don’t want that.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Phthalates</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Usually, those ingredients are meant to homogenize the product and dissolve solid ingredients. Also used to make the fragrance stay...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Same as parabens… they disrupt your hormones and mess the hormone system up...

To summarize, it's important to keep in mind that when you look up for your skin care product's contents, the ingredients are enlisted with the highest quantity first. They go down the list in a descending order (from more to less)...

So the first ingredient listed is the main ingredient with the highest quantity of the product.

If you come across a “baddie” ingredient it’s going to be less of a big deal if it’s at the end of the list (ex. 0.05% of the whole product), rather than if it’s close to the top (ex. 50% of the whole product).

</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Audio post</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/04/05/audio-post/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 12:02:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=36</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[audio mp3="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/sound1.mp3"][/audio]

While I was on track to find out more about the secret to a clear skin I've learned a few things. Firstly, it is definitely worth avoiding some of the heavily chemical ingredients, which are usually included typical makeups contents.

But then again, a majority of the natural skin care products tend to contain coconut oil, which is rather comedogenic. And this basically leaves me wondering now...

But anyway… let’s talk about which specific chemicals and comedogenic ingredients are the ones to be definitely avoided in your makeup products, and why.

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Extreme skin sensitivity</span></h4>
Clogged Pores, Sensitive Red Skin, Rosacea are all the telling signs that your skin health suffers from an extreme sensitivity...

The chemicals included in it, can act to heighten an increase in skin's sensitivity, as well as it can thin your skin and remove the protective barrier. This means that the skin and pores become too responsive towards what you're applying on it.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Trapped skin pores inflammation</span></h4>
The blood flow, which usually follows even the slightest skin stimulation then gets trapped within the pore. Those pores, in turn, get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and chemical ingredients, which will simply stagnate there.

This blood flow stagnation scars the natural collagen in the pore (collagen being our skin’s supportive and regenerative component), so the scar tissue will die and get clogged inside the pore alongside the dead skin cells.

This results in scarring, pitting, big pores, and lots of redness and breakouts. If you can't yet spot that scarring on the surface now, if left unfixed it will inevitably become more visible over time.

And if the pressure in the skin's pores gets too high, it will become full on inflammation, rupture the pore and spread to the next pore, spreading the problem across your skin.
<h6><strong>Okay so let’s get to the ingredients oftentimes used in the skin care products, that you may want to be avoiding:</strong></h6>
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Silicones</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Methicone, dimethicone, trimethicone, cyclomethicone, siloxane, cyclopentasiloxane, cyclotetrasiloxane, cyclohexasiloxane, silsesquioxane, trimethylsiloxysilicate, methylpolysiloxane, stearoxytrimethylsilane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Add a silky and smooth touch...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Apparently silicones are one of the most harmful ingredients out there. They contribute to dehydrating the skin and clogging the pores, which oftentimes marks the beginning of redness, pore scarring, and acne breakouts.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Petrochemicals</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Paraffin wax, mineral oil, toluene, benzene, petrolatum, and anything that ends in “eth”, “decane”, or contains the words PEG (polyethylene glycol), DEA (diethanolamine), MEA (ethanolamine), TEA (triethanolamine), butyl, methyl, propyl, ethyl, ethanol

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

It usually either locks the moisture in the skin pores, keeping it moisturized or acts as a skin preservative in any other relevant way...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Petroleum derived ingredients are pore clogging components, which work as a delivery agent, meaning they trap all other junk in the product deeper into the pores. Sometimes they may come with such hazardous ingredients as the 1,4-dioxane, a carcinogen and neurotoxin...
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Parabens</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

acnemethylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparaben, butylparaben

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

All of these are highly toxic and are harmful to your endocrine system. In other words, those are hormone messer uppers. When you are trying to heal from acne, you don’t want that.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Phthalates</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Usually, those ingredients are meant to homogenize the product and dissolve solid ingredients. Also used to make the fragrance stay...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Same as parabens… they disrupt your hormones and mess the hormone system up...

To summarize, it's important to keep in mind that when you look up for your skin care product's contents, the ingredients are enlisted with the highest quantity first. They go down the list in a descending order (from more to less)...

So the first ingredient listed is the main ingredient with the highest quantity of the product.

If you come across a “baddie” ingredient it’s going to be less of a big deal if it’s at the end of the list (ex. 0.05% of the whole product), rather than if it’s close to the top (ex. 50% of the whole product).

	<item>
		<title>Reasons to use Witch Hazel for skin care</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/04/05/reasons-to-use-witch-hazel-for-skin-care/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 12:05:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=41</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<blockquote>
<h4><q>As a former massage salon worker myself, I can tell you that this salon is one of the best. They do everything the right way, and their girls' hands are... </q></h4>
<h5><cite>Elisa Maryhood</cite></h5>
</blockquote>
<blockquote>
<h4><q>As a former massage salon worker myself, I can tell you that this salon is one of the best. They do everything the right way, and their girls' hands are... </q></h4>
<h5><cite>Elisa Maryhood</cite></h5>
</blockquote>

While I was on track to find out more about the secret to a clear skin I’ve learned a few things. Firstly, it is definitely worth avoiding some of the heavily chemical ingredients, which are usually included typical makeups contents.

But then again, a majority of the natural skin care products tend to contain coconut oil, which is rather comedogenic. And this basically leaves me wondering now…

But anyway… let’s talk about which specific chemicals and comedogenic ingredients are the ones to be definitely avoided in your makeup products, and why.

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Extreme skin sensitivity</span></h4>
Clogged Pores, Sensitive Red Skin, Rosacea are all the telling signs that your skin health suffers from an extreme sensitivity...

The chemicals included in it, can act to heighten an increase in skin's sensitivity, as well as it can thin your skin and remove the protective barrier. This means that the skin and pores become too responsive towards what you're applying on it.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Trapped skin pores inflammation</span></h4>
The blood flow, which usually follows even the slightest skin stimulation then gets trapped within the pore. Those pores, in turn, get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and chemical ingredients, which will simply stagnate there.

This blood flow stagnation scars the natural collagen in the pore (collagen being our skin’s supportive and regenerative component), so the scar tissue will die and get clogged inside the pore alongside the dead skin cells.

This results in scarring, pitting, big pores, and lots of redness and breakouts. If you can't yet spot that scarring on the surface now, if left unfixed it will inevitably become more visible over time.

And if the pressure in the skin's pores gets too high, it will become full on inflammation, rupture the pore and spread to the next pore, spreading the problem across your skin.
<h6><strong>Okay so let’s get to the ingredients oftentimes used in the skin care products, that you may want to be avoiding:</strong></h6>
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Silicones</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Methicone, dimethicone, trimethicone, cyclomethicone, siloxane, cyclopentasiloxane, cyclotetrasiloxane, cyclohexasiloxane, silsesquioxane, trimethylsiloxysilicate, methylpolysiloxane, stearoxytrimethylsilane

<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Petrochemicals</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Paraffin wax, mineral oil, toluene, benzene, petrolatum, and anything that ends in “eth”, “decane”, or contains the words PEG (polyethylene glycol), DEA (diethanolamine), MEA (ethanolamine), TEA (triethanolamine), butyl, methyl, propyl, ethyl, ethanol

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

<strong>Names:</strong>

acnemethylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparaben, butylparaben

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

All of these are highly toxic and are harmful to your endocrine system. In other words, those are hormone messer uppers. When you are trying to heal from acne, you don’t want that.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Phthalates</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Usually, those ingredients are meant to homogenize the product and dissolve solid ingredients. Also used to make the fragrance stay...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Same as parabens… they disrupt your hormones and mess the hormone system up...

To summarize, it's important to keep in mind that when you look up for your skin care product's contents, the ingredients are enlisted with the highest quantity first. They go down the list in a descending order (from more to less)...

So the first ingredient listed is the main ingredient with the highest quantity of the product.

If you come across a “baddie” ingredient it’s going to be less of a big deal if it’s at the end of the list (ex. 0.05% of the whole product), rather than if it’s close to the top (ex. 50% of the whole product).

</div>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Are facial care sessions a pampering or a health necessity?</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/05/17/are-facial-care-sessions-a-pampering-or-a-health-necessity/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 May 2016 12:10:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=44</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[gallery ids="2120,2057,2041,2047,2049"]

It's always been a common question, that a majority of our clients have always been asking us... Basically, facial care, which involves skin cleansing &amp; pores cleansing are so much more than just the aesthetics enhancing techniques. In fact, "opening skin up" with the help of all these cosmetology procedures improves the skin's health and the immunity of...

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Extreme skin sensitivity</span></h4>
Clogged Pores, Sensitive Red Skin, Rosacea are all the telling signs that your skin health suffers from an extreme sensitivity...

The chemicals included in it, can act to heighten an increase in skin's sensitivity, as well as it can thin your skin and remove the protective barrier. This means that the skin and pores become too responsive towards what you're applying on it.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Trapped skin pores inflammation</span></h4>
The blood flow, which usually follows even the slightest skin stimulation then gets trapped within the pore. Those pores, in turn, get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and chemical ingredients, which will simply stagnate there.

This blood flow stagnation scars the natural collagen in the pore (collagen being our skin’s supportive and regenerative component), so the scar tissue will die and get clogged inside the pore alongside the dead skin cells.

This results in scarring, pitting, big pores, and lots of redness and breakouts. If you can't yet spot that scarring on the surface now, if left unfixed it will inevitably become more visible over time.

And if the pressure in the skin's pores gets too high, it will become full on inflammation, rupture the pore and spread to the next pore, spreading the problem across your skin.
<h6><strong>Okay so let’s get to the ingredients oftentimes used in the skin care products, that you may want to be avoiding:</strong></h6>
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Silicones</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Methicone, dimethicone, trimethicone, cyclomethicone, siloxane, cyclopentasiloxane, cyclotetrasiloxane, cyclohexasiloxane, silsesquioxane, trimethylsiloxysilicate, methylpolysiloxane, stearoxytrimethylsilane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Add a silky and smooth touch...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Apparently silicones are one of the most harmful ingredients out there. They contribute to dehydrating the skin and clogging the pores, which oftentimes marks the beginning of redness, pore scarring, and acne breakouts.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Petrochemicals</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

Paraffin wax, mineral oil, toluene, benzene, petrolatum, and anything that ends in “eth”, “decane”, or contains the words PEG (polyethylene glycol), DEA (diethanolamine), MEA (ethanolamine), TEA (triethanolamine), butyl, methyl, propyl, ethyl, ethanol

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

It usually either locks the moisture in the skin pores, keeping it moisturized or acts as a skin preservative in any other relevant way...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Petroleum derived ingredients are pore clogging components, which work as a delivery agent, meaning they trap all other junk in the product deeper into the pores. Sometimes they may come with such hazardous ingredients as the 1,4-dioxane, a carcinogen and neurotoxin...
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Parabens</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

acnemethylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparaben, butylparaben

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

All of these are highly toxic and are harmful to your endocrine system. In other words, those are hormone messer uppers. When you are trying to heal from acne, you don’t want that.
<h5><span style="color: #006899;">Phthalates</span></h5>
<strong>Names:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

<strong>What they are supposed to do:</strong>

Usually, those ingredients are meant to homogenize the product and dissolve solid ingredients. Also used to make the fragrance stay...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

Same as parabens… they disrupt your hormones and mess the hormone system up...

To summarize, it's important to keep in mind that when you look up for your skin care product's contents, the ingredients are enlisted with the highest quantity first. They go down the list in a descending order (from more to less)...

So the first ingredient listed is the main ingredient with the highest quantity of the product.

If you come across a “baddie” ingredient it’s going to be less of a big deal if it’s at the end of the list (ex. 0.05% of the whole product), rather than if it’s close to the top (ex. 50% of the whole product).

</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>Video post</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/2016/04/05/video-post/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 12:13:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?p=47</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=butN0wy9c58

While I was on track to find out more about the secret to a clear skin I've learned a few things. Firstly, it is definitely worth avoiding some of the heavily chemical ingredients, which are usually included typical makeups contents.

But then again, a majority of the natural skin care products tend to contain coconut oil, which is rather comedogenic. And this basically leaves me wondering now...

But anyway… let’s talk about which specific chemicals and comedogenic ingredients are the ones to be definitely avoided in your makeup products, and why.

First thing first, shall we talk about a few key terms before we move forward? That will help us in
<div id="u188" class="text">
<h4><span style="color: #006899;">Dehydration</span></h4>
Skin dehydration is a basic process of when your skin is healthy, it will get rid of  dead skin cells up and out through the skin pores (in other words, it exfoliates itself and regenerates the new skin).

Still, there's a whole multitude of chemical products that will dehydrate your skin (ie. not enough water left in the skin layers). As your skin is dehydrated, it will begin to trap those dead skin cells and the chemical junk leftover in makeups and other skin care products into your pores.

If that's true, the skin will be responding actively to even the slightest external stimulation... That kind of reaction starts sending more blood flow to the area, making your face red and blotchy, resulting in some bright long lasting hyper-pigmentation marks, increased acne, etc.

<strong>Examples:</strong>

propylene glycol, PEG-40, laureth sulfate, phenoxyethanol, butylene glycol or butyl stearate, EDTA (ethylene-diamine-tetracetatic acid), isopropyl alcohol, methylparaben, ceteareth-20, BHA (butylated hydroxyanisole), BHT (butylated hydroxytoluene), dodecane

Supposedly they make the mold growth stop and also extend the shelf life of the product...

<strong>What they actually do:</strong>

pthalatesDEP (diethyl phthalate), DBP (di-n-butyl phthalate), BzBP (benzylbutyl phthalate)

	<item>
		<title>FAQs</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/faqs/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2016 13:30:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/?page_id=638</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section" transparent_background="on" allow_player_pause="off" inner_shadow="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" padding_mobile="off" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" make_equal="off" use_custom_gutter="off" module_class="faqs"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h2>FAQs</h2>
With thousands of Orlando, Florida citizens and the tourists from all around the US and the world being serviced by our salon since 1998, there's some pattern which we've spotted... All of the clients have a quite similar set of questions.

This page is designed to give straightforward &amp; helpful answers to the most popular queries which we've ever gotten...

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" divider_style="solid" hide_on_mobile="on" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q:</strong>  Will you remind me of my appointment, so I don't miss it?</span></h5>
<strong>A:</strong>  We always keep convenience as a key factor in mind.

Specifically for a purpose of providing you with the best SPA session reminding service, we always inquire at least 2 contacting details, when taking up your appointment booking:
<ul>
 	<li>Your phone and an alternative phone number to send you a Text messaging reminder</li>
 	<li>Your email address in order to send you a reminder letter</li>
</ul>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q:</strong>  Talking about facial skin care, is there a way to minimize the appearance of my dilated pores?</span></h5>
<strong>A:</strong>  Absolutely! That can be easily achieved by regularly performing a cleansing procedure, ideally while using AHA products...

All of that and so much more are possible when visiting our SPA and having professional facials regularly.

Our product recommendation: *Guinot Pure Balance Serum.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> My skin is extremely sensitive It can react from various environmental factors as well as from different health and beauty care products I use. What do recommend for my skin type?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:   </strong>For those of our clients who are experiencing the following symptoms: blotchiness, redness, bumps, rash-like symptoms, uncomfortable, frequent dryness, you will want to go to Sources of Soothing.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> What methods of payment are accepted?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:   </strong>We've got three ways of paying for your SPA procedure with us:
<ul>
 	<li>Any US credit card</li>
 	<li>Cash</li>
 	<li>Gift card</li>
</ul>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> What is your policy regarding cancellation?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Our salon has a 24-hour cancellation policy, applicable for all individual services.

If you're a returning customer, who was not able to inform us of the cancellation beforehand, then a 50% cancellation fee may be applied to your account without sufficient notice. All of our spa packages require a 50% deposit at the time of booking.  We do require 48 hours notice for any cancellations of spa packages...

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Do you offer lunch?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Sure thing!

Each of our clients, regardless of the procedure they've signed up for are entitled to a hot or cold beverage.

We also provide a selection of cookies for your enjoyment. Light catering or lunch are available upon request prior to appointment for a charge of $30 (plus tax) per person.

Please keep in mind, that a prior notice is required when booking catering.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Do you offer any SPA &amp; skin care services, tailored specifically for men?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Sure! In fact, currently, we're the only SPA in Orlando, Florida which recognized a significant surge of men's interest in SPA &amp; wellness procedures...

Our "Gentlemen's Services" pack is a perfect option for SPA relaxation &amp; skin care, tailored specifically for men!

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Are your salon's premises easily accessible by those with disabilities?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Our SPA &amp; skin care salon is committed to excellence in serving all customers including people with disabilities. Please feel free to view our detailed Accessible Customer Service Plan.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> May I bring my child to your SPA Salon during my services?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>For the sake of undisturbed relaxation for both you and all other clients, children under 10 years of age are not permitted in the salon or spa.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Does your SPA salon offers hosting a private party of some kind? If yes, what's your top scale for a number of guests?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>We would love to have you host a private party or special event at our spa. Please contact our event coordinator at spa@demolink.org for details and options available to you and your guests.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Do you offer gift cards or certificates?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Surely! We've got a range of gift certificates and cards, all of which grant application at absolutely any of our range of services.

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h5><span style="color: #006899;"><strong>Q: </strong> Do you have some kind of a Discount Club?
</span></h5>
<strong>A:  </strong>Yes, we do! You can learn more about the advantages and price cuts available to our Discounts Club members on a respective page of our website!

[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section]]]></content:encoded>

<h3>Meet Our Team</h3>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="38px" divider_style="solid" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="35" height_phone="30" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" global_module="647" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off" parallax_3="off" parallax_method_3="off" parallax_4="off" parallax_method_4="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="1_4"][tm_pb_team_member global_parent="647" admin_label="Person" name="Mary Fruition" position="Salon's owner" image_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/team04.jpg" animation="off" background_layout="light" facebook_url="https://www.facebook.com/TemplateMonster" twitter_url="https://twitter.com/templatemonster" google_url="https://plus.google.com/+TemplateMonster" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone" custom_padding_last_edited="on|phone" custom_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/team/mary-fruition/"]
<p id="cache8"><span id="cache9">Before setting up her own salon, Mary's been working at a prestigious SPA venue in North Carolina...</span></p>
<p id="cache10"><span id="cache11">There she was able to save a sufficient amount of a principal capital in order to set up her very own SPA &amp; skin care salon in Orlando, Florida...  </span></p>
[/tm_pb_team_member][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_4"][tm_pb_team_member global_parent="647" admin_label="Person" name="Emily Nichols" position="Senior SPA specialist" image_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/team02.jpg" animation="off" background_layout="light" facebook_url="https://www.facebook.com/TemplateMonster" twitter_url="https://twitter.com/templatemonster" google_url="https://plus.google.com/+TemplateMonster" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone" custom_padding_phone="30px|||" custom_padding_last_edited="on|desktop" custom_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/team/emily-nichols/"]

<span id="cache21">Emily's career as a SPA care specialist has spanned to include work at numerous prestigious salons across the US...But after moving with her family from the state of New York to Orlando, Florida, Emily have made a fortunate decision to become a part of our salon's team!</span>

[/tm_pb_team_member][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_4"][tm_pb_team_member global_parent="647" admin_label="Person" name="Stacy Blunt" position="Junior SPA specialist" image_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/team03.jpg" animation="off" background_layout="light" facebook_url="https://www.facebook.com/TemplateMonster" twitter_url="https://twitter.com/templatemonster" google_url="https://plus.google.com/+TemplateMonster" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop" custom_padding_tablet="30px|||" custom_padding_last_edited="on|desktop" custom_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/team/stacy-blunt/"]
<p id="cache8"><span id="cache9">The reason why Stacy is so natural with everything regarding skin's health and skin care treatments may have to do with her prior medical degree...</span></p>
<p id="cache10"><span id="cache11">For a few years following her med school graduation she's been soul searching for a perfect job field, and thankfully she found one!</span></p>
[/tm_pb_team_member][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_4"][tm_pb_team_member global_parent="647" admin_label="Person" name="Danielle Johns" position="Junior SPA specialist" image_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/team05.jpg" animation="off" background_layout="light" facebook_url="https://www.facebook.com/TemplateMonster" twitter_url="https://twitter.com/templatemonster" google_url="https://plus.google.com/+TemplateMonster" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone" custom_padding_tablet="30px|||" custom_padding_last_edited="on|phone" custom_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/team/danielle-johns/"]
<p id="cache9"><span id="cache10">Danielle has been working in a SPA industry well since she was 17... Her skills and her positive style of work have swiftly made her our leading specialist in the feet and hands treatment fields!</span></p>
<p id="cache11"><span id="cache12">Also, Danielle is the head of our SPA salon's Gentlemen's services department. </span></p>
[/tm_pb_team_member][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="20" divider_style="solid" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="18" height_phone="16" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section]]]></content:encoded>

<h2>Book a Spa session</h2>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="30" divider_style="solid" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="27" height_phone="25" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_booked_calendar admin_label="Booked Calendar" switcher="off" size="large" calendar="24"] [/tm_pb_booked_calendar][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section]]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Facial care</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/spa-skin-care/facial-care/</link>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="50" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="30" height_phone="20" height_last_edited="on|desktop" saved_tabs="all"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h2>Facial care</h2>
While everyone knows, that having a regular facial skin care session is vital for keeping up with your health and keeping your look fresh and young, we know it better, than anybody else!

That's all due to our long experience in providing thousands of women with a top notch level of facial skin care, with its quality and price kept intact.

All of our SPA specialists have an amazingly extensive practical experience and all of the cosmetic facial products that we're using have a great record of acclaim and immediate results, instantly seen after one of our care procedures...

&nbsp;

<strong>Here's a definite list of categories of skin care that we offer our services in: </strong>

&nbsp;

[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" max_width="250px" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin="||0px|" custom_margin_tablet="||15px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone"]
<ul>
 	<li>Cleansing</li>
 	<li>Deep Cleansing &amp; Acne</li>
 	<li>Steaming</li>
 	<li>Lifting Brightening Effect</li>
 	<li>Facial masks</li>
 	<li>Mezo Therapy</li>
</ul>
[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" max_width="250px"]
<ul>
 	<li>Exfoliation</li>
 	<li>Gold Therapy &amp; Collagen Booster</li>
 	<li>Serum</li>
 	<li>Hair Scalp Treatment</li>
 	<li>Face massages</li>
</ul>

<h3>Hear our happy patients' testimonials:</h3>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="7" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="6" height_phone="5" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off" parallax_3="off" parallax_method_3="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Elisa Major" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_1.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" custom_margin_tablet="||20px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop"]

[/tm_pb_testimonial][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Emily Watford" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_2.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Whenever I feel depressed, anxious or just tired, I always need to take some chill pill and relax... Luckily, I always have had this place for those matters... Here I can both delve into a meditative rest and also take care of my skin's health...

[/tm_pb_testimonial][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="94px" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="50" height_phone="40" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section][tm_pb_section admin_label="Section" fullwidth="off" specialty="off" transparent_background="on" allow_player_pause="off" inner_shadow="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" padding_mobile="off" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" make_equal="off" use_custom_gutter="off"][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" global_module="355" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="off" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" column_padding_mobile="on" background_color="#ffffff"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider global_parent="355" admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="82" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="50" height_phone="40" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text global_parent="355" admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

		<title>Body treatments</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/spa-skin-care/body-treatments/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Jun 2016 15:35:31 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="50" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="30" height_phone="20" height_last_edited="on|desktop" saved_tabs="all"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h2>Body treatments</h2>
Treating your body with care and love is an essential way to stay looking young, to keep your skin radiantly fresh and healthy...

Our cosmetologists and aestheticians have proved time and again, that they're capable of providing an excellent range of body treatment services, while keeping their focus on a great customer experience as well...
<h6><strong>Here's a list of body treatment services that our SPA currently has:</strong></h6>
[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin="||0px|" custom_margin_tablet="||15px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone"]
<ul>
 	<li><strong>Body Scrub</strong>
A regular body scrub is basically designed to get rid of all dull skin cells and impurities, making your skin smooth and silky!</li>
 	<li><strong>Milk &amp; Honey Nourishing</strong>
This exfoliation-based technique will be an ultimate way to relax for anyone!</li>
 	<li><strong>Soothing scrub</strong>
Scrubbing for your skin with the use of lavender, sea salt and a small vitamin C facial injection... Immediately followed by one of our therapeutic body massages.</li>
 	<li><strong>Acupressure Massage</strong>
Stimulating one's key skin points can result in a complete re-activation of your immune system and triggering self-healing mechanisms, which will give you much more energy to go with!</li>
 	<li><strong>Seaweed Revitalizing Wrap</strong>
This wrapping will refresh your skin, out the skin toxins and will open up your skin's pores, so it will breathe again, becoming more elastic and refreshed...</li>
 	<li><strong>Dirt Revitalizing Wrap</strong></li>
</ul>

<h3>Hear our happy patients' testimonials:</h3>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="7" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="6" height_phone="5" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off" parallax_3="off" parallax_method_3="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Elisa Major" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_1.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" custom_margin_tablet="||20px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop"]

Every once in a while, we girls just have to take a break from our routine daily hectic errands and job and just step aside for some relaxation... Whenever I do it, this is the place where all the relaxation starts at for me...

[/tm_pb_testimonial][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Emily Watford" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_2.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Whenever I feel depressed, anxious or just tired, I always need to take some chill pill and relax... Luckily, I always have had this place for those matters... Here I can both delve into a meditative rest and also take care of my skin's health...

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="50" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="30" height_phone="20" height_last_edited="on|desktop" saved_tabs="all"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h2>Medi-spa</h2>
Besides providing regular face &amp; body skin care and a range of other SPA services, we have a separate medical SPA range as well...
<h6><strong>All of the services below are provided by licensed aestheticians and cosmetologists:</strong></h6>
&nbsp;

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" max_width="600px"]
<ul>
 	<li><strong>Dermal Fillers</strong>
Those are meant for getting rid of facial wrinkles and lines</li>
 	<li><strong>Botox Injections</strong>
That's an ultimate way to stop your aging and make it look beautiful</li>
 	<li><strong>Skin Rejuvenation</strong>
Laser, light and chemical peels are used to refresh and tighten your skin</li>
 	<li><strong>Laser Hair Removal</strong>
Meant to work the magic which waxing does not do</li>
 	<li><strong>B-12 Injections</strong></li>
</ul>
[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="36" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="30" height_phone="25" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_slider admin_label="Slider" show_arrows="on" show_pagination="off" auto="off" auto_ignore_hover="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="on" remove_inner_shadow="on" background_position="default" background_size="default" hide_content_on_mobile="off" hide_cta_on_mobile="off" show_image_video_mobile="off" custom_button="off" button_letter_spacing="0" button_use_icon="default" button_icon_placement="right" button_on_hover="on" button_letter_spacing_hover="0" module_class="custom-swiper" saved_tabs="all"] [tm_pb_slide background_image="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/services_bodyTreatments.jpg" background_position="default" background_size="cover" background_color="#ffffff" use_bg_overlay="off" use_text_overlay="off" alignment="center" allow_player_pause="off" text_border_radius="3" header_font_select="default" header_font="||||" body_font_select="default" body_font="||||" custom_button="off" button_font_select="default" button_font="||||" button_use_icon="default" button_icon_placement="right" button_on_hover="on"]

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="20" height_last_edited="on|phone" divider_style="solid"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_blurb admin_label="Blurb" title="555–123–2323" url_new_window="off" use_icon="on" font_icon="f095" icon_color="#006899" use_circle="on" circle_color="#ffffff" use_circle_border="on" circle_border_color="#006899" icon_placement="left" animation="off" text_orientation="center" use_icon_font_size="off" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" circle_size="60" circle_border_width="1" icon_font_size="50px" circle_size_last_edited="on|desktop" header_text_color="#006899"] [/tm_pb_blurb][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="20" height_last_edited="on|phone" divider_style="solid"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="80" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="50" height_phone="40" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][/tm_pb_section][tm_pb_section admin_label="Section" fullwidth="off" specialty="off" transparent_background="off" background_color="#5e6d86" allow_player_pause="off" inner_shadow="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" padding_mobile="off" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" width_unit="on" make_equal="off" use_custom_gutter="off"][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="82" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="40" height_phone="30" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_cta admin_label="Call To Action" button_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/book-a-spa-session/" url_new_window="off" button_text="Book a SPA session" use_background_color="off" background_color="#0095e5" text_orientation="left" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_button="off" button_letter_spacing="0" button_use_icon="default" button_icon_placement="right" button_on_hover="on" button_letter_spacing_hover="0" module_class="invert text-center" max_width_tablet="100%" max_width_last_edited="off|desktop" header_font="Great Vibes||||" header_font_size="50" header_font_size_tablet="40" header_font_size_phone="30" header_font_size_last_edited="on|desktop" saved_tabs="all"]
<h3>If you're looking for that perfect relaxation getaway... or want to take care of your skin's health and looks, then we're the place to go... We provide an ultimate, universal set of SPA &amp; skin care procedures for both women and men!</h3>

<h3>Hear our happy patients' testimonials:</h3>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="7" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="6" height_phone="5" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off" parallax_3="off" parallax_method_3="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Elisa Major" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_1.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" custom_margin_tablet="||20px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop"]

Every once in a while, we girls just have to take a break from our routine daily hectic errands and job and just step aside for some relaxation... Whenever I do it, this is the place where all the relaxation starts at for me...

[/tm_pb_testimonial][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Emily Watford" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_2.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]

Whenever I feel depressed, anxious or just tired, I always need to take some chill pill and relax... Luckily, I always have had this place for those matters... Here I can both delve into a meditative rest and also take care of my skin's health...

<h2>Massages</h2>
Massages have always been a vital part of any essential SPA range of services... Besides providing a great stress relief and a profound level of relaxation for anyone, massages are also proven to be good for your health! Basically, any good skin care session must include a massage, fit specifically for the treatment type a patient gets... <strong>Currently, we have the following massage services available:</strong> [/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" max_width="300px" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin="||0px|" custom_margin_tablet="||15px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone"]
<ul>
 	<li>Swedish Massage</li>
 	<li>Aroma Massage</li>
 	<li>Deep Tissue Massage</li>
 	<li>Deep Facial Massage</li>
</ul>
[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" max_width="300px"]
<ul>
 	<li>Revitalizing Facial Massage</li>
 	<li>Stimulating Feet Massage</li>
 	<li>Stimulating Arms &amp; Hands Massage</li>
 	<li>Stimulating Neck and Back Massage</li>
</ul>

		<title>Feet treatments/pedicure</title>
		<link>http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/spa-skin-care/feet-treatmentspedicure/</link>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[tm_pb_section admin_label="section"][tm_pb_row admin_label="row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="50" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="30" height_phone="20" height_last_edited="on|desktop" saved_tabs="all"] [/tm_pb_divider][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
<h2>Feet treatments/pedicure</h2>
Taking a good care of your feet and nails is essential.

We provide an ultimate, SPA-induced services for refreshing your health and enhancing your aesthetics...
<h6><strong>We currently provide following services:</strong></h6>
&nbsp;

[/tm_pb_text][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row"][tm_pb_column type="4_4"][tm_pb_text admin_label="Text" text_orientation="center" max_width="600px" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" custom_margin="||0px|" custom_margin_tablet="||15px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone"]
<ul>
 	<li><strong>Regular Pedicure</strong></li>
 	<li><strong>Spa Pedicure</strong>
Callus Removal + Mud Pack + Hot Towel Wraps + Lotion Massage</li>
 	<li><strong>Gel Pedicure</strong></li>
</ul>

<h3>Hear our happy patients' testimonials:</h3>
[/tm_pb_text][tm_pb_divider admin_label="Divider" color="#ffffff" show_divider="off" height="7" divider_style="solid" divider_position="top" hide_on_mobile="on" height_tablet="6" height_phone="5" height_last_edited="on|phone"] [/tm_pb_divider][/tm_pb_column][/tm_pb_row][tm_pb_row admin_label="Row" make_fullwidth="off" use_custom_width="off" use_grid_padding="on" width_unit="on" padding_mobile="off" allow_player_pause="off" parallax="off" parallax_method="off" make_equal="off" parallax_1="off" parallax_method_1="off" parallax_2="off" parallax_method_2="off" parallax_3="off" parallax_method_3="off" column_padding_mobile="on"][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Elisa Major" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_1.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" custom_margin_tablet="||20px|" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop"]

[/tm_pb_testimonial][/tm_pb_column][tm_pb_column type="1_2"][tm_pb_testimonial admin_label="Testimonial" author="Emily Watford" url_new_window="off" portrait_url="http://ld-wp.template-help.com/wordpress_59014-sample/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/testi_2.jpg" quote_icon="off" use_background_color="off" background_color="#f5f5f5" text_orientation="left" portrait_border_radius="50%" portrait_width="116" portrait_height="116" use_border_color="off" border_color="#ffffff" border_style="solid"]
